attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.

attributes.action: Allow our FIREFIGHTERS to use seized & impounded vehicles for training purposes.
attributes.background: FIREFIGHTERS have to purchase scrap vehicles in order to train in essential skills such as roof & door removal, car fires & people extraction so that WE can be saved in emergency situations. WHY are we crushing vehicles seized at the roadside when we could GIVE these to the FIRE FIGHTERS!? Help NOW!
attributes.additional_details: Firefighters have to buy scrap vehicles from their own budgets at times when front line services are being cut and cars, seized at the roadside by the Police are being crushed into cubes when they could be used in training. Purchased vehicles are used VERY sparingly in order to extend training as they cannot afford to buy them when seized cars are being cubed daily. These skills that require practice save lives - please sign this petition as it could be your life saved by your signature one day!

attributes.action: Abandon plans to force companies to 'list foreign workers'
attributes.background: The Government has announced that it wants to force companies in the UK to list how many foreign workers they employ, with the purpose being to 'name and shame' employers who do not employ enough British workers. This highly Xenophobic policy is demeans the country we live in and should be withdrawn
attributes.additional_details:
Immigrants are human beings and they do not deserve to be treated unequally. If the government presses forwards with this policy it will open the door to yet more hatred and division in British society, and push us close to the kinds of policies widespread in Europe in the 1930s

-- 

Quote in the Petition title taken from the Times front page, 05/10/16

attributes.action: Make sexism a hate crime across the UK and in all institutions
attributes.background: Sexism is not yet legally a hate crime which is making court cases difficult due to no specific law dictating what counts as sexist abuse. Nottingham is already attempting to make it a hate crime but this will not be effective until it is on a big scale.

attributes.action: Stop Theresa May allowing schools to wholly discriminate based on religion
attributes.background: Theresa May wishes to relax the school admission rules to allow them to select every child from one religion. Creating environments where children would not come into contact with a children from a different background to themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
The complete segregation of children will encourage a more disparate society in the future, with less understanding of each other.

Schools should exist to educate - not to encourage tribalism. 

Furthermore; religious schools do not allow a free, independent arena for children to learn to question. When a child receives religion from a place of worship, home and school - there is no space to form an independent opinion. It's tantamount to brain washing.

attributes.action: A newborn baby to be screened for Krabbe Disease
attributes.background: I have a best friend that tried years to get pregnant. When she finally become pregnant she was over the moon. She then become pregnant with her second child which was then found out to have Krabbe Disease at 13 months old which there is currently no cure for and they don't screen for when born.
attributes.additional_details: In America they screen newborn babies for Krabbe Disease but not in the uk. This is a very serious condition which there is no cure. It is a gene which one or both parents carry and can pass it on to the child without even knowing. If it's not found early enough then a child can die by the age of two years with late onset Krabbe Diease. This needs to become part of screening with a newborn ASAP. Please help make this happen!!

attributes.action: Increased protection for beneficiaries under Mirror Wills following first death.
attributes.background: My father and stepmother prepared Mirror Wills whereby the estate first passed to the surviving spouse and then to my stepbrother and myself in equal shares.  After my father died my stepmother changed her Will and left everything to her own family.  I lost my family inheritance of approx Â£150,000
attributes.additional_details:
I would like the following changes. (1)  A  formal warning to be included in all Mirror Wills that your final wishes may not be respected should you die first.  (2) A new legal requirement than any beneficiary under a Mirror Will  subsequently disinherited must receive formal written notice for it to have effect.
My story has been featured in the National Press, television and radio and is included in the current  television series of the BBC production "Rip Off Britain"

attributes.action: Keep the production, sale and use of cannabis illegal.
attributes.background: Cannabis is a harmful drug. It's not a recreational substance that should be classed as "legal" as doing this will only make it more accessible to vulnerable young people and consequently cause more damage to our society.

attributes.action: Return the District Councils to Cornwall
attributes.background:
Since Cornwall Council was formed it has wasted so much money. 

It is time for the government to return Cornwall to District Councils and to abolish Cornwall Council.

attributes.action: Health Research Tax on all UK Taxpayers - let's finally cure Cancer and the rest
attributes.background:
A new tax used to fund Health Research, a small amount taken every month from all taxpayers and used to fund medical research. Suggested monthly figure for UK tax brackets:

Basic - 40p
Higher - 50p
Additional - Â£1

Such a small amount per person will generate Â£100m+ per year (HMRC Stats).
attributes.additional_details:
Based on HMRC Stats for 2016 tax year:

24.7m Basic rate = Â£9.8m
4.4m Higher rate = Â£2.2m
0.3m Additional rate = Â£0.3m
Total = Â£12.4m p/m

Funds to be given to single disease until cured then move to next (order TBD).

Suggest management board made of unpaid visionaries who are only interested in making the world better (i.e. Musk, Branson, Dyson etc.)

The Ice Bucket Challenge raised Â£87m for ALS research leading to the discovery of a gene that will allow them to start developing treatments.

attributes.action: Raise benefits for the disabled
attributes.background: We are from NCS and we're supporting Skills for Life, a charity who help people with learning disabilities. Recent changes to our community has caused living with a disability much more difficult as benefits have been cut. Therefore, we would love to help and raise benefits for the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all the great things charities such as Skills for Life do, they now have to charge their service users to continue they're amazing work. This should not be the case, especially now that it is becoming less affordable due to the cut in benefits.

attributes.action: Make a&e more equipped with private room& bathroom when dealing with miscarriage
attributes.background: Its the most horrific experience for a women and her partner to go throught and should be dealt with respectful no women should have to sit in a room full of people or have to clean herself up in a dirty bathroom that drunks go in in a&e

attributes.action: Have a minimum age of 12 years old before having a body piercing.
attributes.background: Babies and toddlers often have their ears pierced because their parents think it will look nice. It causes the child pain and puts them at risk of infection. It should be left to the individual as to whether they wish to have holes made through their own skin when they are old enough to understand.

attributes.action: Invest in more Gender Clinics around the UK
attributes.background: There are currently two Gender Clinics in the UK - one in London and one in Leeds. The waiting list for both clinics can be up to 18 months, sometimes even longer, because of the increase in acceptance and openness about gender identity.
attributes.additional_details: I was referred to Tavistock in London in April/May 2016 and my referral got accepted around November 2016, I am still currently waiting for an appointment 9/10 months on from my referral date. From personal experience, the NHS are an incredible asset to the UK and without it we'd undeniably be in a much worse position. However, Gender Clinics are very far stretched and I struggle with the wait hugely which has major impacts on my mental health. I'm not the only one with this issue, fact.

attributes.action: All Taxi drivers licensed to Halton have free travel across the Mersey Gateway
attributes.background: Currently all Halton residents Using a Taxi will have to pay Â£4.00 per crossing only to get back Â£2.00 per crossing this is putting us out of pocket as we where promised the crossing free of charge by David Cameron and George Osborne.
attributes.additional_details: This fee that Halton residents will have to pay will leave them out of pocket because we don't drive. There are also NHS resources that need Taxis to ferry blood to Whiston Hosptial and other NHS sites in the area. Also George Osbourne and both David Cameron have made promises http://www.merseygateway.co.uk/2014/07/chancellor-of-the-exchequer-george-osborne-announces-free-trips-across-both-silver-jubilee-and-mersey-gateway-bridges-for-all-halton-residents/

attributes.action: Offer U.K. citizenship to all E.U. citizens with permanent residence status
attributes.background:
There are many eu citizens who have built a life for themselves in this country over many years. Their children may have been educated here, they may bought property or married u.k. citizens,.
as things stand despite all they have contributed they face an uncertain future. They deserve security

attributes.action: Change law to require LA's to provide 15 min free parking in all LA parking bays
attributes.background: Often drivers feel they have received a parking ticket for staying only a few seconds over their designated period. There a distrust between drivers and local authorities, drivers believing that they are being penalised by Councils raising parking fees to cover other council spending.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013 LAs made Â£635 million surplus from parking revenue.

attributes.action: Form cross party committee to agree strategy & funding of the NHS & care support
attributes.background: We need to agree a long term strategy for the NHS, to ensure we maximise our incredible resources and expertise. We have difficult choices to make: modernising to ensure we offer a consistent 7 day service; identify a way to fund the increasing demand; and how we fund elderly care in the community.
attributes.additional_details:
We have an increasingly ageing population with improved medical advances. The service needs to remove the administrative burdens and focus on efficient world class care, which will require moving to a manufacturing shift pattern impacting ALL staff, requiring cross party support. 
To maximise the use of hospital beds we need to review the control & funding of aftercare/nursing homes to ensure quality and remove the bottlenecks between the NHS and local authorities, changes to tax structure?

attributes.action: Include women in the national screening programme for abdominal aortic aneurysms
attributes.background: Public Health England run a national screening programme for men aged â¥65 to detect abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA). If left undetected, a AAA rupture is fatal in 90% of cases. The condition is not unique to men, women also suffer and die from AAA ruptures. So why aren't women also screened?
attributes.additional_details:
Screening is a way of detecting an aneurysm early. If the abdominal aortic artery gets particularly swollen, you might feel a pulsating feeling or pain in your stomach or back pain. If you don't experience this, you wonât know you have an aneurysm until it bursts, when it becomes an emergency and is usually fatal.
Ruptured AAAs are less common in women and, on average, occur 10 years later than in men.So why is there not a screening programme for women aged 75 or above? Women are equal!

attributes.action: Make the police buy cars that are made in the UK and stop buying premium brands.
attributes.background: The UK has a large number of people employed in the automotive industry,  buying UK built cars helps secure UK jobs,  there is no need for the police to have  expensive BMW imported cars and Jaguar premium brand UK cars when a Vauxhall for example make a cheaper alternative that is made in the UK.

attributes.action: Make the law clear that any child who assists in for profit work is employed
attributes.background: Thousands of children, many of them younger than 13 in the UK, are working in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy. See http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/4308213/Thousands-of-children-being-paid-to-market-products-to-schoolmates.html
attributes.additional_details: The Children and Young Persons Act 1933 prohibits children younger than 13 being used to assist in for-profit work such as that described above. However, problems with enforcing this law have caused many to turn a blind eye to this. The result is many children are being exploited âhave no workersâ rights, are deprived of pay and can end up doing work such as for-profit clinical testing that is unsafe for them, and so the law needs to be made clearer to ensure this does not happen.

attributes.action: GPs to be reviewed and retrained each time misdiagnosis of cancer
attributes.background: My son was misdiagnosed three times by GPs which lead to stage three. As they are the first point of call they need to spot this early and listen to parents. This happens too many times and no one is reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: I know of three cases, myself, two friends. All GPs incorrect medical knowledge of cancer.

attributes.action: Education funding should be ring fenced pupils funded equally.
attributes.background: Changes announced today (14 December) in the way schools will be funded in the future is just robbing Peter to pay Paul. Children are our future and they should be educated equally whenever they live.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are oversubscribed in some areas and others undersubscribed however equal funding would  hopefully address this problem and enable heads to allocate funding according to the needs of their pupils.

attributes.action: Evacuate Aleppo with joint UN task force, giving refuge in Britain to citizens.
attributes.background: The city of Aleppo has been conquered by the dictator Assad. His forces are massacring its people - men, women and children. It is preventable. Ask the government to petition a UN/EU task force to immediately go into the city as peacekeepers, not to directly fight Assad, but to evacuate citizens.
attributes.additional_details: All over twitter, Aleppo refugees are posting how the government is murdering them en masse. Innocent men, women and children. The UN must condemn the massacre as against international law, and the UN, failing them the EU, failing that Britain alone, mut notify Assad of its intent, and send a task force to the city. Not to fight Assad's forces directly, but to advise his troops to not engage, & to protect any citizen fleeing the city against his troops, withdrawing when the people are removed.

attributes.action: Compulsory cardiac screenings (once every 6 months) for those who do any sport.
attributes.background: Some people have have died whilst part taking in sports, such as Robin Chard aged 48 who died of cardiac arrest whilst cycling to raise money for a cancer charity.
attributes.additional_details: These are only a few examples listed, but if we had routine cardiac screenings these incidents would have been caught earlier and treatment would have been provided.

attributes.action: Stop Supermarkets from using unnecessary packaging for fruits and veg.
attributes.background: Why wrap up avocados, cucumbers, bananas, potatoes, peppers, etc.? These can be easily displayed in supermarkets' shelves without the plastic as they have natural skin protection. This packaging will go straight to our bins which may end up in landfill or even in our rivers and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: Using packaging for fruit and veg that have natural skin protection is creating waste for the sake of waste. The misuse of plastics can be seen in supermarkets like Aldi, Asda, Tesco, Sainsbury's, Coop, etc. These companies need to take environmental responsibility and adopt sustainability as part of their corporate strategy.

attributes.action: To make November 11th a bank holiday
attributes.background: To remember all the fallen heros

attributes.action: Protect Whistleblowers in care sectors who are dismissed after whistle blowing
attributes.background: How many people working in any care sector have had to blow the whistle to find shortly after the procedure,they lose their job?I ask to protect whistleblowers after whistleblowing procedure.Future disciplinary hearings(or the like)to be held by different members of staff than the original procedure
attributes.additional_details: Whistleblowers need more protection than they get currently in the care sector. Too many people who choose to stand for the right thing and fight, lose their jobs in the end-these righteous people are the people we need working as doctors, nurses, support workers etc. There must be a change.

attributes.action: Create a national database to check who has a current DBS certificate.
attributes.background: I believe there is a massive loophole, which potential allows paedophiles and other inappropriate adults access to the most vulnerable in our society. As parents/guardians we no right to check DBS certificates are in place. Neither the Charity Commission or the DBS check they have been done.
attributes.additional_details: I had reason to ask for confirmation that DBS certificates were in place at a charity my sister attends (she is a vulnerable adult). They refused, their response to my request was to threaten to report me to the Police for harassment. The charity is now being investigated by SAFA - Hertfordshire Police unit responsible for 'Safeguarding Adults from Abuse'due to serious Safeguarding issues.

attributes.action: All products with gelatine must be labelled clearly,animal or vegetable gelatine
attributes.background: There are many products on the market which contain gelatine. Gelatine is found in our foods, sweets and in our pharmaceutical products,these are just a few examples. Clear labelling on EVERY product that contains gelatine and what type of gelatine it is, be it from animals or vegetables.

attributes.action: Binding quota of gender representation in all public & government offices
attributes.background: Currently the male and female population are not equally presented in UK public & government offices. The UK is ranked 49th in the world with regards to the number of women in national parliaments.  Norway implements a binding quota: each gender is represented by a minimum of 40% of members.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 UK General Election: men made up 71% of MPs; 74% of Members of House of Lords; 68% of elected councillors; 87% of local authority council leaders.  Women make up 43% of Labour MPs, 21% of Conservative MPs, 36% of SNP MPs, 13% of elected mayors. While the majority of medical students are female and 80% of NHS staff are women, women make up just 28% of trust chairs. We need binding quotas, the appropriate framework & effective sanctions for noncompliance. Lets implement binding quotas.

attributes.action: Make care for teenagers/young adults with disabilities free for working parents.
attributes.background: As a continually working parent of a child with a disability, it is impossible to find child care for my son either reasonably priced or even available. Unless I have a family member to look after my son outwith school hours I cannot work. Let's make this care available and free for working parents.

attributes.action:
Create non-geographical parliamentary 
constituencies for our Armed Forces.
attributes.background: Depending on individual circumstances, service personnel register to vote using an address which is either: their current address; one where they would reside but for their service, or a previous address. Thus personnel at any one location may be represented by MPs, from across the political divide.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Armed Forces deserve to elect their own MPs, rather than have them chosen by an electorate with little appreciation of service life and the conditions under which the military operate both here and abroad.
Without independent representation, or a formal federation, our Armed Forces are unable to make their views known in a coherent manner.  Non-geographical constituencies will enable service personnel to elect their own MPs, wherever they serve or live, and be seen as an identifiable entity.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of tobacco products in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco products such as cigarettes kill 100,000 people around the  the UK in one year. It also harms many other people through second hand smoking. The life expectancy of a smoker is about 10 years less than a non smoker. Wouldn't it save many more lives if you banned the sale of tobacco products?
attributes.additional_details: http://patient.info/health/smoking-the-facts

attributes.action: Make legal, individual to be in possession and smoke small quantity of cannabis
attributes.background: Cannabis is an illegal drug throughout the UK, although there may be scientific evidence to prove that it may be harmful but isn't it an individual's right to make that decision whether is be harmful to themselves or not. It should be legal for small quantity but not enough for distribution
attributes.additional_details: It provides medical benefits that some prescription drugs cannot

attributes.action: Fund counselling for fathers of children who have been affected by sexual abuse
attributes.background: Calling on the Government to fund counselling for fathers of children who have been affected by sexual abuse as they fund mothers and the child which is brilliant but the fathers suffer too and this is totally unfair considering the amount of hurt and suffering fathers go through too.
attributes.additional_details: This has affected my family and it really hurts is that I cannot get counselling unless I "PAY" which the child and the mother gets it funded, we are in 2016 and this is totally unfair and needs changing.

attributes.action: Return the railways to full state control and ownership
attributes.background:
High prices, rotten service on our trains..Let get our railways back to full state ownership so profits benefit train users not shareholders..
Each private contract ends so it can be taken over by the state. No big buyouts needed..

attributes.action: Open Drug Crisis Centres. stop death and crime with compassion and help.
attributes.background: It is a fact the war on drugs is not working. People are dying without help or a chance to get help.  Glasgow has just  opened its doors on a Drug crisis centre. It helps people to handle and control their substance abuse, offers help guidance and rehabilitation to those who would like to get better
attributes.additional_details: If you want to know more about how drug prohibition does not work. A good book is Chasing the Scream or Neil Woods, book Good cop, Bad war. It does not matter how much we spend trying to stop use of drugs it does not ease the problem it just makes it worse. Canada had a massive drug problem until they opened up safe centres for people to use and to get help. Portugal have stopped making drugs illegal and again the problems are being tackled, less death and crime. More Compassion4Progression

attributes.action: Give more mental health training to professionals - emergency services and A&E
attributes.background: I've had trips to A&E and other incidents with the police where I felt the staff weren't adequately trained and aware of mental health

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and invest billions saved into the NHS.
attributes.background: Average income for pensioners is now higher than for workers. The Work and Pensions Committee says the 'triple lock' (which cost an extra Â£6bn in 2015) is "unsustainable" and "more intergenerationally unfair" on younger families.
attributes.additional_details:
By targeting pensioner welfare at only those who need it we can save billions to fund our NHS.

1) The 'triple lock' guarantees that the state pension rises each year by the highest of either inflation, average earnings, or 2.5%.
2) The 'triple lock' cost an extra Â£6 billion in 2015 - Government Actuary's Department.
3) The average pensioner has a higher income than the average worker, after housing costs and dependants had been taken into account  - IFS, 2015.
4) The Work and Pensions Committee called the 'triple lock' "unsustainable" and "unfair" on younger families - November 2016.

attributes.action: Stop new Child Maintenence Service going by Gross income instead of Net income.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service is now going by gross income instead of fathers actual net pay.
attributes.additional_details: How can the new Child Maintenance Service justify going by gross income instead of net income? How can us fathers pay for our children with money that we do not even receive? I'm all for paying for our children but adding 20% charges on top if you use the collect and pay Service? Not all families have the luxury of their child's mother being co operative and will force you to use CMS. They don't even consider your monthly expenses such as mortgage etc. Please help and get the government to stop this ridiculous change before we all end up homeless and jobless.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Allow children access to more speech therapy on the NHS.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to offer more speech therapy on the NHS.  I have been fighting to get my son help for 2 years. We have to pay privately for someone to listen to us. We are seen weekly privately, but the NHS won't offer anywhere close to this. Our son has made so much progress having weekly sessions.

attributes.action: Regulate to ensure all rental properties are toxic mould and fungus free
attributes.background: Many of us are living in rented accommodation unfit for habitation. Toxic mould and fungus are lethal and nobody should be in that environment. I believe it is a breach of our human rights and breaks rules set out in our tenancy agreements, yet we are helpless and move from one place to the next.
attributes.additional_details: It sounds bizarre but nobody is regulating this. I'm not talking about a bit of condensation, I'm talking about when the building you live in is rotten. I'm talking about the landlords that paint over various toxic mould and damp problems to move a new tenant in so months later a jungle of danger grows back through, all the while a network of fungus roots start to form beneath the floor and then you have mushrooms sprouting. Tough regulation and penalties are needed to stop estate agents, landlords, freeholders, from making us ill.

attributes.action: Men to be given automatic parental responsibility like women when a baby is due.
attributes.background: Woman have fought hard for their equal rights and they got it, which is just right, but when it comes to pregnancy men do not have the same rights as women and I aim to change that. I am a father to be and I have discovered that a father has to be registered on the birth certificate to have the....
attributes.additional_details: same rights as the mother to their new born child unless courts say otherwise. I want you to ask yourself something, what happens when both parents break up and the mother has a severe dislike to the father? lots of people act out of anger. The father has to pay thousands of pounds just to see his child a few days a week when he probably doesn't deserve that kinda treatment. people judge today by the actions of stupid men in the past but if we are all equal then why is the father the outcast?

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to deny estranged parents to be denied access to kids
attributes.background: It should be law that the estranged partner, be automatically allowed access to their children. If they truly pose a risk to them, the onus should be with the partner the children reside with to go to court prove why they feel it is not in the children's best interest to see the other parent.
attributes.additional_details: This mainly affects estranged Fathers, and now there is no legal aide for family matters, and the fact CSA take up to 40% of their wage for maintainence that they have to pay despite them being denied any kind of relationship with their children, a lot of Fathers can't afford to go to court. This is not equality!! If the children are young they can't express their needs, the law needs to ensure they do not suffer. We have enough childhood Depression. We need to put the children first.

attributes.action: Urge UN deployment of observers for safe evacuation of civilians and rebels
attributes.background: The Syrian Regime has failed to allow safe passage for besieged civilians and rebels to leave Aleppo and has resumed shelling. Thousands risk being massacred. The UK Government must support and urge the UN to deploy International Observers to facilitate the evacuation of all civilians and rebels.
attributes.additional_details:
As of the 14th of December 2016, France's Foreign Minister has called for the deployment of UN observers, but this has not been raised to the UN, nor does it stipulate safety for all civilians and militants. 

"What France demands is the presence of observers of the United Nations on the ground to have a guarantee that the evacuation, which is a priority for the civilians, [takes place], but also so that militants are not massacred," (Jean-Marc Ayrault - quoted by Les Echos newspaper).

attributes.action: Campaign for greater involvement of the UK in the refugee resettlement
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is because we believe that the UK isn't allowing the enough number of refugees into the UK. Also we should be allowed to be part of the decision of allowing refugees in or not because at the end of the day it is the public who put decision makers in power.
attributes.additional_details: As we have put the decision makers in power they need to understand that without us they wouldn't be in power and also the reason they are in power is so that our voice can be heard.

attributes.action: Reinstate legal aid for students and people on a low income
attributes.background: Many people need the help of solicitors and courts all around the UK for various reasons but can't afford the costs by themselves. The 1st of April 2013 saw legal aid was discontinued. This petition will see that people are able to receive help in many cases that legal aid covered.
attributes.additional_details:
When legal aid was discontinued this meant some types of case were no longer eligible for public funds - including divorce, child contact, welfare benefits, employment, clinical negligence, and housing law except in very limited circumstances. (BBC news) 
This petition should be looked into by Houses of Parliament and even if only a few were reinstated for legal aid such as child contact being the main issue as every parent and child should be together and some parents can't afford legal costs.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered âa conservation emergencyâ by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.
